title: Collaborative Learning-Based Mathematics Project Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Core middle school mathematics concepts and foundational pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Short intensive course for current secondary teachers conducted at corporate education centers, providing collaborative learning environments utilizing digital devices (laptops, tablets, etc.)

learning_goals: Learners effectively integrate team members' expertise when designing math projects according to collaborative learning principles.

Learners analyze three math problems reflecting actual classroom situations and submit within a week an engagement-driven learning design plan including two activities (e.g., cooperative learning, role-play) that encourage student participation in problem-solving processes.

During a 1-week project, learners analyze three or more practical issues, apply a reflective practice framework (problem cause → alternative evaluation → action plan), and submit improvement proposals in a one-page report.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
